summary: 1 in 12 hospitalized patients either carries or is infected by an antibiotic-resistant “superbug” at any one time. new research into new bird flu virus fuels growing global concerns about the risks posed by the virus. the virus first came to the attention of the global community in late march 2013. as of May 29, 131 people in china had been infected and 37 people had died. auditor general of Canada criticizes federal government and public health agency. study points to benefits of pharmacy-based surveillance in flu outbreaks. study was published in the May 24, 2013, issue of the PHAC's Morbidity and Mortality Weekly Report. the new severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS)–like virus is a “threat to the entire world”. many questions remain about its origins and how people are getting infected. she urges all member countries to pull together their resources.
